billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO CULTURAL AFFAIRS, TOURISM, PARKS AND RECREATION

title: Creates the "New York state civil war 150th anniversary commemoration commission"
summary: Creates the "New York state civil war 150th anniversary commemoration commission" to plan and execute an organized series of reenactment tourism events.
currentCommittee: CULTURAL AFFAIRS, TOURISM, PARKS AND RECREATION

       Introduced  by  Sen. MAZIARZ -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Tourism,
         Parks and Recreation

       AN ACT to create a temporary New York state civil war 150th  anniversary
         commemoration  commission;  and  providing  for  the  repeal  of  such
         provisions

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Legislative  findings.  The  legislature hereby finds and
    2  declares that there is a need to create a New York state civil war 150th
    3  anniversary commemoration commission to promote the 150th anniversary of
    4  the American civil war which will take place between the years 2011  and
    5  2015.  The  primary focus of the New York state civil war 150th anniver-
    6  sary commemoration commission will be to plan and execute  an  organized
    7  series of civil war reenactment tourism events.
    8    The  legislature finds that the creation of a New York state civil war
    9  150th anniversary commemoration commission is necessary to bring togeth-
   10  er persons qualified by experience and/or by powers vested  in  them  by
   11  their offices to coordinate and facilitate such a multi-year event.
   12    S  2. New York state civil war 150th anniversary commemoration commis-
   13  sion; created. 1. There is hereby created a temporary  state  commission
   14  to  be  known as the "New York state civil war 150th anniversary commem-
   15  oration commission".
   16    2. Definitions. As used in this act:
   17    a. "Commission" means the New York state civil war  150th  anniversary
   18  commemoration commission created by this section.
   19    b.  "Re-enactor"  means  a person who is a recognized member of a duly
   20  constituted reenactment organization approved by the host site  and  who
   21  participates in the main civil war reenactment event for the year.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01683-01-1

       S. 197                              2

    1    3.  a.  The  commission shall consist of 14 members to be appointed as
    2  follows:
    3    The  commissioner  of the department of parks, recreation and historic
    4  preservation or his or her duly designated representative,  the  commis-
    5  sioner  of  the  department  of  education or his or her duly designated
    6  representative, the commissioner of the department of economic  develop-
    7  ment or his or her duly designated representative, and 11 members of the
    8  civil war reenactment community of whom three members shall be appointed
    9  by the governor, three members shall be appointed by the temporary pres-
   10  ident  of the senate, three members shall be appointed by the speaker of
   11  the assembly, one member shall be appointed by the  minority  leader  of
   12  the  senate  and one member shall be appointed by the minority leader of
   13  the assembly. The commissioner of the department of economic development
   14  or his or her duly designated representative shall serve as  chairperson
   15  of the commission. The eleven appointed members shall serve at the plea-
   16  sure of the appointing official. Vacancies shall be filled in the manner
   17  provided for original appointments.
   18    b.  The  members  of  the commission shall receive no compensation for
   19  their services.
   20    c. Notwithstanding any inconsistent provision of any general,  special
   21  or  local  law,  ordinance, resolution or charter, no officer, member or
   22  employee of the state or of any public corporation shall forfeit his  or
   23  her  office or employment by reason of his or her acceptance of appoint-
   24  ment as a member of the commission, nor shall service as such commission
   25  member be deemed incompatible or in conflict with such office or employ-
   26  ment.
   27    d. The commission shall appoint such staff  as  may  be  necessary  to
   28  carry out its duties.
   29    S 3. Powers and duties of the commission. 1. The commission shall have
   30  the following powers and duties:
   31    a.  To  coordinate  the  commemoration of the 150th anniversary of the
   32  civil war for the years 2011 through 2015;
   33    b. To plan and execute an organized series of  civil  war  reenactment
   34  tourism events;
   35    c.  To  promote  civil  war educational studies in grades kindergarten
   36  through twelve in New York state schools; and
   37    d. To design two special "metal alloy" medallions to issue exclusively
   38  to those re-enactors who are duly authorized and who participate in  the
   39  main  reenactment  event of each year. A medallion shall be prepared for
   40  issuance to American forces and a separate and distinct medallion  shall
   41  be prepared for issuance to Confederate forces.
   42    2. The commission shall work with forts within New York state that are
   43  planning  civil  war  reenactment events. Each fort shall have authority
   44  over how such events are handled.
   45    S 4. The commission may employ and at pleasure remove  such  personnel
   46  as  it  may  deem necessary for the performance of its functions and fix
   47  their compensation within the amounts made  available  by  appropriation
   48  therefor.  The  commission may meet and hold public and/or private hear-
   49  ings within or without the state, and shall have all  the  powers  of  a
   50  legislative committee pursuant to the legislative law.
   51    S  5.  The  commission may request and shall receive from any subdivi-
   52  sion, department, board, commission, office, agency, or other instrumen-
   53  tality of the state or of any political subdivision thereof such facili-
   54  ties, assistance and data as it deems necessary  or  desirable  for  the
   55  proper execution of its powers and duties and to effectuate the purposes
   56  set forth in this act.

       S. 197                              3

    1    S  6.  The commission is hereby authorized and empowered to enter into
    2  any agreements and to do and perform any acts  that  may  be  necessary,
    3  desirable  or  proper  to  carry out the purposes and objectives of this
    4  act.
    5    S  7.  The  commission  shall continue in existence until December 31,
    6  2015, at which time it shall be deemed to be repealed.
    7    S 8. This act shall take effect immediately.
